Хочу вам рассказать интересный факт из Главы 12: Наши Покровители  
Забавно Вид на Сити 17 - это буквально спутниковый снимок ночного Бруклина. При этом город показан освещённым множеством огней, хотя после битвы он оказался значительно разрушен, да и до сражения в городе не было такого количества освещения.Вид на Сити 17 - это буквально спутниковый снимок ночного Бруклина. При этом город показан освещённым множеством огней, хотя после битвы он оказался значительно разрушен, да и до сражения в городе не было такого количества освещения. 
Ещё есть интересный факт
Глава 10: Нарушитель номер один 

В другом переводе название главы "Главный нарушитель забавно"

Глава 9а: Запутанность
В этой главе, как и во всех следующих, больше не встречаются муравьиные львы, что делает приманки из фероподов бесполезными. Забавно то, что в тихих помещениях депо всё же можно услышать отдалённые возгласы солдат, сражающихся с муравьиными львами.
Название главы ссылается на квантовую запутанность.

I mean.... this game is a classic for any original Half-life fans. Im starting to feel kinda old now... lol. Cant beat the 2 price tag during the winter sale to relive this masterpiece. Any fan of counter strike will probably have played this through at least once. Its a wonderful game that introduced the source engine into single player and the gravity gun is just... so much fun, even all this time later. Gotta get garrys mod next.

The first game did not resonate with me in any way what so ever and I grew up with the PS1/Mega Drive so I don't even know what my issue was (90's kid), though it had it's moments it disappointed me enough that I left this 1 sit a few years. This game, though? Wow. Motivated to play Half Life: Alyx, I finally finished my first play through just a few minutes ago and was hooked from start to finish. Holds up extremely well for sure. This is incredibly well written with extremely varied map design which smoothly transitions almost between multiple genres so incredibly fantastic it can often feel an entirely different game. Gun play is basic by current standards as is usual with Source Engine games, but still engaging enough, the puzzles are well paced, voice acting is fairly strong, controls feel modern and everything in-between just feels so cohesive. I won't make this review go on as not many will be interested in a long review for an older title, plus I don't tend to write them either, but this game was too good not to contribute to it's Overwhelmingly Positive review status.

I've been playing Garry's Mod for like a decade. It was originally an offshoot of this game, which I was never interested in playing even with it's infamous nature. Finally, I saw the whole series on sale and decided to try it out, because why not. I can now say I am a huge fan of the Half-Life universe and can only praise the creative team on everything that went into this.

If you're the kind of gamer who:

- Loves a well-made narrative with fleshed out characters you'll remember
- Enjoys feeling like a badass as you shoot your way through level after level
- Wants an atmospheric game that has a world you'll love to investigate, even after you've finished the game
- Needs some killer tracks
- is a speedrunner (Don't even get me started, there's no way you haven't bought this game already).

And can deal with:

- Finishing this entire series and still wanting more even though it's likely there won't be a new Half-Life release for a long time now
- It being, compared to a lot of games these days, pretty short
- Ummmmmmm scary Ravenholm??? I don't think there's many other cons I can bring up here

Then you'll be taking out zombies, headcrabs, combine, striders, helicopters, camera drone-things, and antilions with glee.

Now RISE AND SHINE motherfucker, not to imply you've been a lazy piece of shit, but it's time to wake up and smell the ashes.
